newsitem.title: USA: Brazil '96/97 orange crop at 18.3 mln tonnes--USDA.
newsitem.headline: Brazil '96/97 orange crop at 18.3 mln tonnes--USDA.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department on Tuesday forecast the 1996/97 Brazil orange crop at a record 18.3 million tonnes, up 8 percent from its revised estimate for the previous year.
Oranges from the 1996/97 crop will be harvested during the last seven months of calendar 1997, USDA said in its monthly World Horticultural Production Report.
Oranges processed into juice from the 1996/97 crop are forecast at a record 12.6 million tonnes, up 16 pct from 1995/96, USDA said.
Orange production in Sao Paulo, Brazil's main fresh orange producing region, is forecast to increase 9 percent to 400 million 40.8 kilogram boxes, USDA said.
However, the department noted that producer and trade estimates of the Sao Paulo orange crop range from 380 to 405 million boxes.
Increased Sao Paulo production is due to both higher yields and more fruit-bearing trees, USDA said. Production in other regions is expected to remain stable.
